{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2504.12242v1", "title": "On $p$-adic congruences involving $\sqrt d$", "summary": "Let $p$ be an odd prime and let $d$ be an integer not divisible by $p$. We
prove that $$ \prod_{1\le m,n\le p-1\atop p\nmid m^2-dn^2}\ (x-(m+n\sqrt{d}))
\equiv \begin{cases}\sum_{k=1}^{p-2}\frac{k(k+1)}2x^{(k-1)(p-1)}\pmod p
&\text{if}\ (\frac dp)=1,\\\sum_{k=0}^{(p-1)/2}x^{2k(p-1)} \pmod p&\text {if}\
(\frac dp)=-1, \end{cases}$$ where $(\frac dp)$ denotes the Legendre symbol.
This extends a recent conjecture of N. Kalinin. We also obtain the
Wolstenholme-type congruence $$\sum_{1\le m,n\le p-1\atop p\nmid m^2-dn^2}\ \
\frac1{m+n\sqrt d}\equiv0\pmod{p^2}.$$", "main_category": "math.NT", "categories": "math.NT", "published": "2025-04-16T16:47:10Z"}
